feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Can we use 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) without UPA in "Public" Edition?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are currently considering an ERP replacement from our existing SAP ECC environment to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I have a question about the relationship between scope item 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) and UPA.

Background:
- Current: SAP ECC environment
- Previous project: S/4HANA Private Cloud Discovery Workshop
→ Decision made NOT to use Universal Parallel Accounting (UPA/6DF)
→ As a result, 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) was marked as "out of scope"

- Current project: S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Discovery Workshop in progress
→ Planning to use standard costing to actual costing processes
→ Therefore, we want to include 3F0 (Event-Based Manufacturing Cost Posting) in scope
→ Customer questioned the difference from the previous project

Questions:
1. Documentation states "UPA is mandatory in Public Edition," but can we use
3F0 alone WITHOUT enabling UPA (6DF)?

2. Or does using 3F0 in Public Edition mean UPA (6DF) must also be enabled
(i.e., they come as a package)?

3. The Administration Guide table shows "Select 3F0 when UPA is enabled,"
but is the reverse scenario possible: "We want to use 3F0 but NOT UPA"?

Referenced Documentation:
- Administration Guide: States that when UPA (6DF) is enabled, 3F0 should also be selected
- Learning Journey: States "UPA is mandatory in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition"

I would appreciate insights from anyone with actual implementation experience
regarding the relationship between 3F0 and UPA in Private Cloud vs. Public Edition.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Cross-Company Code Cost Allocation and Cost Center Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Sc
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and have questions regarding cross-company code transactions within the same client.

Questions:

1. Cost Allocation Between Company Codes:
- Is it possible to perform cost allocation (assessment/distribution) between different company codes within the same client?
- If yes, which scope item(s) should be activated?
- Which Fiori app(s) should be used?

2. Cost Center Transfer Between Company Codes:
- Is it possible to transfer costs between cost centers in different company codes within the same client?
- If yes, which scope item(s) should be activated?
- Which Fiori app(s) should be used?

What I've found so far:
Based on the blog "Deep Dive: Cross Company topics in Controlling" by Dick Westman, it appears that:
- Universal Allocation (2QL) can be used for cross-company allocations
- Cost Center → Cost Center and Cost Center → WBS allocations are possible
- The "Manage Allocation Cycles" app seems to be the main tool

However, I would appreciate confirmation from anyone with implementation experience:
- Are these the correct scope items for Public Edition?
- Are there any limitations or prerequisites we should be aware?
- Any best practices for setting up cross-company cost allocations?

Thank you in advance for your insights!

entry.title: Lower of Cost or Market Valuation for In-House Manufactured Items (WIP/Semi-Finished Goods) in SAP S
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have questions regarding Lower of Cost or Market (LCM) valuation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Current Operation (ECC environment):
- We perform LCM valuation write-downs for Work in Process (WIP) and semi-finished goods
- These items are manufactured in-house, so they have no purchase prices
- We apply the write-down rate of the parent finished product to calculate write-downs
Example: If Product A has a 10% write-down rate → Apply 10% to its WIP and semi-finished goods

Questions:

1. In Public Edition's standard functionality, is LCM valuation calculated individually for each material code?
Or is there a feature to apply the parent product's write-down rate to WIP and semi-finished goods?

2. For in-house manufactured items (WIP/semi-finished goods), there are no purchase prices.
According to the "Lowest Price Determination Based on Market Price" app (App ID: MRN0),
market prices are retrieved from:
- Goods receipt prices from purchase orders
- Scheduling agreements
- Contracts
- Purchase info records

All of these seem to assume external procurement. Does this mean that
in-house manufactured items without purchase prices are excluded from LCM valuation write-downs?

3. Is there a way to apply LCM valuation to in-house manufactured items?
For example, can we use standard costs or parent product valuation as the basis for write-downs?

4. If the current operation (applying parent product's write-down rate) cannot be achieved with the MRN0 app,
would the workaround be to calculate write-down amounts outside the system and
manually update valuations using 1ZT (Material Price Change and Inventory Value Management)?

Reference Documentation:
- Lowest Price Determination Based on Market Price (App ID: MRN0)
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/7f47a6d9441c46ac86c96fd27f6015f0/7a5fb6531de6b64ce10000000a174cb4.html

I would appreciate any insights from actual implementation experience or workarounds.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Title:"Document Identification When Combining Multiple Standard Reports (SD/MM/FI)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question regarding document identification when combining multiple standard reports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
Due to limitations on creating custom reports in Public Edition, we are considering outputting multiple standard reports and linking them by key fields to create a combined document.

Questions:

1. Document numbers can overlap across SD/MM/FI modules. How should we identify documents uniquely?

Example:
- SD Sales Document Number: 1234567890
- MM Purchasing Document Number: 1234567890
- FI Accounting Document Number: 1234567890

2. What combination of fields is required to uniquely identify a document?
- Is Document Number + Document Type sufficient?
- Are Company Code, Fiscal Year, and Organization (Sales Org/Purchasing Org) also required?

3. When linking reports from different modules (e.g., SD report and FI report), what common key fields should be used?
Do we need to use reference document number fields?

4. Are there limitations on which key fields can be output in standard reports?
Are there cases where necessary identification fields cannot be output in certain reports?

I would appreciate any insights from actual implementation experience or best practices.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to Track Offsetting Accounts Through Interim Accounts (e.g., Payables → GR/IR → Inventory) in S/
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I have a question about tracking offsetting accounts through interim accounts in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Scenario:
In the procurement process with GR/IR clearing account, the accounting flow is:

1. Goods Receipt:
DR: Inventory 100
CR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100

2. Invoice Receipt:
DR: GR/IR Clearing Account 100
CR: Accounts Payable 100

Question:
When reviewing Accounts Payable line items, the offsetting account shows "GR/IR Clearing Account." However, we need to trace back to the original offsetting account (Inventory) that was posted when the goods were received.

In other words: Accounts Payable → GR/IR → **Inventory**

Is there a standard way in Public Edition to:
1. Display this multi-level offsetting account relationship in a single report?
2. Download a list showing the complete flow (AP → GR/IR → Inventory)?
3. Automatically link the invoice document to the original goods receipt accounting document?

Current Understanding:
- FI documents only show direct offsetting accounts (1-to-1 relationship)
- Standard reports like "Display Journal Entries" show GR/IR details but don't automatically link to the original inventory posting

Questions:
1. Is there a standard Fiori app or report that can trace through interim accounts?
2. Does the "Manage GR/IR Clearing Account" app (if available) provide this functionality?
3. Would we need to use custom queries via BTP/SAC to achieve this?
4. Are there any best practices for this requirement in Public Edition?

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Can We Download App ID, Reference Information, and Object Text with Journal Entries/G/L Account Line
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We have a question about downloadable fields when exporting journal entries and G/L account line items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Background:
We operate with multiple company codes and plants, and need to track:
- Which app was used to post each document
- Whether posting was manual or automatic
- Reference/source information

Questions:

When downloading data from standard apps like:
- Display Journal Entries
- Display G/L Account Line Items

Can we include the following fields in the download?

1. **App ID (Transaction Code equivalent)**
- Which Fiori app was used to create the document
- Example: F0717 (Post General Journal Entries), F1814 (Enter Supplier Invoice)
- Or at minimum: Document Type (SA, KR, DR, etc.)

2. **Reference Processing Information**
- Reference Document Number
- Original Document Number
- Purchase Order Number (for MM documents)
- Sales Order Number (for SD documents)
- Any indicator of manual vs. automatic posting

3. **Object Text**
- Document Header Text
- Line Item Text
- Cost Center Text / WBS Text
- (Clarification: We're also not 100% sure what "Object Text" refers to - any insights?)

Current Understanding:
- App ID is likely NOT stored in FI documents
- Reference document numbers might be available
- Various text fields should be available as selection options

Questions:
1. Which of these fields are actually available in standard journal/G/L reports?
2. Can they be added as columns in the download/export?
3. Are there alternative apps or reports that provide this information?
4. Any workarounds if these fields are not available in standard reports?

We're trying to avoid custom development if possible and want to use standard functionality.

Any insights from actual implementation experience would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Where is item that Payment Terms in JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In?
entry.content:
Dear All.

We use JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In in this Project.

I thought that payment information(payment terms, payment method, DueCalculationBaseDate, etc.) is derived by supplier master, but, this is not correct.
Because, As far as I can tell, the payment method was blank and the DueCalculationBaseDate was today.

If there is a way to derive payment information from the vendor, please let me know.
If not, I would like to ask how to enter the payment information.  Is the only option that entry directly to item of payment method, etc.

Best Regards,

entry.content:

For example, if the job for September has been completed and then the job for November was run directly.

entry.title: Split WT during Putaway 不启用HU包装管理，仓库上架根据单托重量拆分行上架需求开发是否有系统增强点
entry.content:
仓库上架根据单托重量拆分行上架需求开发是否有系统增强点，我们并未找到增强点，希望知道此需求的具体实现方式；期待您的回复，谢谢~

Translation In English:

No HU management, but we want to split the WT due to weight during putaway. Is there any BADI can be used?

Note: "WT Generic" is set as "Only Storage Type", the destination bin is not specified until WT confirmation.

entry.title: Timeouts When Maintaining Large Business Roles in S/4HANA Public Cloud (3SL – CBC)
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

In our S/4HANA Public Cloud 3SL (CBC) Development and Test tenants, we are experiencing persistent issues when maintaining a large business role that includes all available business catalogs (currently more than 1,400).

Whenever we try to update an existing super-user role that already contains approximately 1,000 catalogs, or when we attempt to create a new role containing all catalogs through the “Maintain Business Roles” Fiori app, we receive TimeOut or RunTime errors.

We use this wide-access role for key users to quickly determine whether issues raised by stakeholders—such as after activating new scope items or after upgrades—are related to missing authorizations.

I would appreciate hearing from anyone who has encountered similar challenges. How did you resolve or work around these performance limitations?

Additionally, is there a way to build such a role using the “Create From Template” option instead of manually adding each catalog through the UI? If so, where can the template be found and which fields are required for a successful upload?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Kind regards,
Mike van Ingen

entry.title: Handling RFC Queue Errors in SAP EWM Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In SAP EWM Public Cloud, you can view and reprocess RFC queue errors directly from the Warehouse Monitor. Pending queues are visible there, and you can reprocess them once the underlying issue is resolved.

The real problem starts when the error has no actual fix. For example, an inbound delivery that was already put away, but the logistics period was afterward shifted. This leaves you with an RFC error you cannot resolve, and when you open the queue details there is no option to influence the data container, such as adjusting the posting date. Rejecting the queue does not work either.

Transaction /SCWM/ERP_STOCKCHECK technically exists, but since the queue is still present, you cannot clean up the situation through that check. The only app that seems remotely comparable to transaction SQM2 is F5427 (Manage Queue), yet it does not display anything relevant here.

Question
How can these unresolvable RFC queue errors be corrected in SAP EWM Public Cloud?

Thanks

entry.title: patch/create Account Assignment M for a existing Purchase order in S/4Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
hello there lovely SAP Community, 

 

id like to create a Account Assignment "M" with a reference for a Sales Order and Sales Order item for an already existing Sales order. it needs to be done with a Odata API. 

 

Currently im Struggling with that on Item level a Update on Item lvl needs to be done to Change AccountAssignment Category to "M" and on Account Assingment lvl a Account assingment needs to be Created. 

 

Kinda Like: 

 

A Patch on item lvl. 

 

{
"AccountAssignmentCategory": "M",
      "_PurOrdAccountAssignment": [
        {
          "PurchaseOrderItem": "10",
          "AccountAssignmentNumber": "1",
          "SalesOrder": "335",
          "SalesOrderItem": "000100"
}
]
 
 
}
 
i cant get it work. 
 
Problem: on Item lvl its kinda a Patch of AccountAssignmentCategory... but on Account assignment lvl its a create.
 
So my Question: How to Create a Account Assignment on a already existing Purchase Order via Odata. 
 
kind regards, 
Philipp

entry.title: eDocument SII – Canceled invoice before submission does not generate “accepted” status
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working with the eDocument process for SII in Spain and I have encountered the following situation:

  • I create a customer invoice.

  • Before submitting it to the SII, I cancel that same invoice.

  • Afterwards, I perform the SII submission.

The result is that an eDocument is generated with status “canceled”, but no eDocument is created for the original invoice with status “accepted”.

My questions are:

  1. Why does the system not generate an eDocument with status “accepted” for the original invoice, even though it was later canceled?

  2. Is this the standard SAP behavior (only creating the cancellation eDocument if the invoice was never transmitted)?

  3. Is there any configuration or SAP Note that allows the system to also generate the “accepted” eDocument in these cases?

  4. Is it possible to generate the XML file for both the original invoice and the canceled invoice, even if the original one was never sent to the SII?

I would really appreciate any guidance or experiences you can share.

Thank you very much,

Jessica Aguil

entry.title: How to set up billing job for the last WD of the month
entry.content: We are on Public Cloud and we use Schedule Billing Creation for Preliminary Billing Documents app to schedule daily jobs. But we would like to set up a recurring job on every last Working Day of a month and I cannot see any option like that. When I choose End of Month there is no way to choose last WD. Only '- some amount of days' but not 0. Any idea how to set it up?

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud ADT Package deleted
entry.content:
Dear All

While working over SAP Public Cloud using Eclipse ADT , we connected it with Git to move the package to another project but due to some unknown reason instead of exporting and importing the package from Git to new projects, its imported back to original project and now many files, applications , cds , https services are inconsistent and many are deleted.

Any possibility to retrieve it back. Like if we can export and import the whole package from QAS back to development system.

entry.title: Authorization in Sales Documents Based on Personnel
entry.content:
Hello,

For sales process, person-based authorization is required in the system, documents in the system need to be segregated both at the organizational level and on a person-specific basis. For example, if there are five people responsible for region X, they should not be able to see each other’s sales orders. We already achieve this at the regional level using standard structures such as divisions. However, when it comes to person-based authorization, there is no relevant object available within the authorization catalogs. In the standard structure, there is no direct support for person-based authorization.

We've tried access restriction in related sales business roles but neither VA01/VA02/VA03 Manage Sales Order nor Manage Sales Order business catalogs seem to contain restriction fields necessary to achieve this filteration. We also implemented BADIs SD_SLS_CHECK_HEAD and SD_SLS_CHECK_ITEM with the hopes of exiting the screen for unrestriced users when they display an unauthorized sales order, however these BADIs can only display error messages inside the document screen as displayed.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: I can't select a user when creating a Professional Services project.
entry.content:
Hello, Expert.

I'm trying to create a "Customer Project" based on the Professional Services (J11) guide in S4HANA Public Edition 2502, but I'm encountering an issue that prevents me from registering the project.

The "Project Manager" field is required, but no items appear.

Where and how do I register this item? (There are multiple users registered in "Manage Workforce.")

I appreciate any help.

Akira Matsuda

entry.title: Authorization In Sales Document Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

For sales process, person-based authorization is required in the system, documents in the system need to be segregated both at the organizational level and on a person-specific basis. For example, if there are five people responsible for region X, they should not be able to see each other’s sales orders. We already achieve this at the regional level using standard structures such as divisions. However, when it comes to person-based authorization, there is no relevant object available within the authorization catalogs. In the standard structure, there is no direct support for person-based authorization. 

We've tried access restriction in related sales business roles but neither VA01/VA02/VA03 nor Manage Sales Order business catalogs seem to contain restriction fields necessary to achieve this filteration. We also implemented BADIs SD_SLS_CHECK_HEAD and SD_SLS_CHECK_ITEM with the hopes of exiting the screen for unrestriced users when they display an unauthorized sales order, however these BADIs can only display error messages inside the document screen as displayed 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Local Currency change impact on Group reporting
entry.content:
We are planning to change the functional currency from local currency to Group currency USD for some of the consolidation units in the ledger Company code settings for local reporting decided by the management.

We need to understand its implication on the Group reporting consolidation unit currency settings which is same as functional currency and the data is transferred from Universal Journal.

Since the data transferred from universal journal is so far in GBP and the data in group reporting is already updated as GBP if we change the currency to USD in GR CU, we would like to understand how the transaction data in group reporting presently in local currency GBP will be converted to USD and how the balances LC is carried forward.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Regarding standard apps, how do you determine if an app is a standard app?
entry.content:
由于我们公司最近在做审计，客户那边认为系统的两个app不是标准得app，所以想请教一下，如何分辨app是不是标准得app。

比如说：物料凭证概览 和库存概览-中国大陆，台湾 这两个app

 

Since our company is currently undergoing an audit, the client believes that two apps in the system are not standard apps. Therefore, I would like to ask for guidance on how to distinguish whether an app is a standard app.

For example: the "Material Document Overview" and "Stock Overview - Mainland China, Taiwan" apps.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.
